column5: Doing my best to leave politics out of this... all I can say is that his heart always seemed to be in the right place. Whether or not his actions helped matters is another issue.  He will definitely be missed. Regardless of what you think of him he was too young to go.
R.I.P Mr. Rob Ford. Sad to see him go so young. Surely he will be missed in political circus.
Any time a man stands up for "the people" I will stand and salute that man! I truly feel that like many good people before him he was taken far too soon!
???  Never knew him, never lived in toronto either.  But he has a wife and kids, and hes a human.  RIP

Doing my best to leave politics out of this... all I can say is that his heart always seemed to be in the right place. Whether or not his actions helped matters is another issue.  He will definitely be missed. Regardless of what you think of him he was too young to go. About says it all.  I will always wonder what he could have contributed after he dealt with his health problems.  His passion for his constituents was unquestionable.
Rex Murphy on  CBC ' s National did a great commentary on Rob last night. RIP  and sincere condolences to all that knew and loved him.
I was not a fan of Rob Ford the politician but he leaves a wife and children behind and I would never wish cancer on my worst enemy.  May he rest in peace.
Looks like he lost the fight.  Not sure what to say. Sure was an entertaining guy.  Not going to be forgotten in our generation I don't think.
Best mayor Toronto has had in a long time.
Yup going to be missed
This is truly sad. Many did not care for his ways, but I challenge anyone to name a mayor in Toronto, who did more for his constituents. I feel for his wife and kids. HH
R.I.P  love him or hate him.. No one can deny he worked for the People.

As said many times Rob Ford really did love his city, and he did things that needed to be done, maybe his methods where a bit rough around the edges but one always knew what his agenda was.  RIP Rob Ford
Toronto lost a Great Man, Rest in peace Rob.
Sad day for Toronto . Rest In Peace Rob Ford.
best mayor Toronto ever had !!! not to mention he really cared for his people and will be missed....
Agreed,little rough around the edges but his agenda was right on. RIP sir,
Rip mr ford.

Not a fan of anybody in politics except Rob Ford, what you see is what you got with this man. A down to earth no nonsense type of guy. The only thing wrong with Rob, is that there are NOT enough politicians like him. He was the best thing that ever happened in Toronto.  Rest in Peace Mr. Ford. God Bless!

Not a fan of anybody in politics except Rob Ford, what you see is what you got with this man. A down to earth no nonsense type of guy. The only thing wrong with Rob, is that there are NOT enough politicians like him. He was the best thing that ever happened in Toronto.  Rest in Peace Mr. Ford. God Bless! Very well said! I'd have loved to see him as Prime Minister!

"..no nonsense type of guy.."  Ha!  I'm not going to bash a dead guy in his RIP thread, but that comment is hilarious and couldn't be more inaccurate.  his politics may or may not have been good for Toronto ( I have no idea I don't live there), but good or bad, absent of nonsense he was not.

Not a fan of anybody in politics except Rob Ford, what you see is what you got with this man. A down to earth no nonsense type of guy. The only thing wrong with Rob, is that there are NOT enough politicians like him. He was the best thing that ever happened in Toronto.  Rest in Peace Mr. Ford. God Bless!   Well said, Rob was for the working class, and the people in lower class as well, visiting personally tenants in Toronto Housing, and getting those mold issues and leaking taps, to no hot water , to roaches to Bedbugs fixed, when the ones responsible turned their heads. Rob was one of the guys who you felt you could call him up and talk to him one on one and he listened, instead of brushing you off. Plus he was one tough fighter, both in politics, and in his battle with cancer  RIP   Great Mayor
RIP Rob Ford, but pls leave politics off this thread.
I feel badly for his wife, kids and family.  Politics aside, he was a man with a family who will miss him terribly.  My condolences go out to them.
I feel bad for his family. I am amazed by the praises he is getting here for his so-called "leadership" and "common man" Bull. Someone dying so young of cancer is always a sad story though.
R.I.P Rob.....
He certainly made politics interesting .. he was a great representative for his constituents.. too bad his personal demons got the best of him..
Some people are very in tune with their body.  Something tells me he knew many years ago something "just wasn't right" .... and lived his life differently as a result.  RIP Mr Ford.
RIP Rob Ford
I get what your saying.  But I also got a little chuckle out of that.  Myself being pretty heavy in to fitness.. Rob didn't seem to be very dialled in to his body.
Good or bad, He is gone now, lets leave the politics out. RIP Mr.Ford. My condolences to his family & friends.

Rough around the edges indeed....and Robbie for PM...lets not get carried away!  Rob Ford always did his best for his constituents and tried his best to keep those left wing morons on city council in check and I admired him for that.  ....no more pain...no more suffering...rest in peace Rob Ford.
